function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of nested PCR with multiple cycles can increase the risk of contamination and false positives.","Impact":"Could lead to misdiagnosis of contagious diseases and unnecessary panic.","Mitigation":"Implement strict clean room protocols and use of negative controls in every run to detect contamination.","Technologies":"Clean room technology, PCR contamination detection systems.","People":"Laboratory technicians, researchers, and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Laboratory managers, research supervisors, health organizations."},{"Description":"Unamplified synthetic DNA used to set up PCR conditions may introduce contamination during subsequent experiments.","Impact":"Risk of false positive results and misinterpretation of experimental data.","Mitigation":"Use alternative methods to set up PCR conditions and implement strict clean room protocols.","Technologies":"Negative control methods, clean room technology, alternative condition setup methods.","People":"Laboratory technicians, researchers, and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Laboratory managers, research supervisors."},{"Description":"Improper handling of sample RNA during cDNA synthesis can lead to contamination and inaccurate results.","Impact":"Risk of false positive/negative results and misinterpretation of experimental data.","Mitigation":"Implement strict clean room protocols and training on proper sample handling techniques.","Technologies":"Clean room technology, sample handling training protocols.","People":"Laboratory technicians and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Laboratory managers, research supervisors, health organizations."}]}
